Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a step towards an Orwellian police state.
The government should not determine what is true or false; this is the responsibility of individuals.
Misinformation and disinformation are inevitable and should be addressed through education and cultural development, not legislation.
The legislation could be used to suppress alternative views and further erode trust in the government.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to free speech and expression.
Notable Quotes: My God are we slipping ever more quickly down that slippery slope into an Orwellian Police State.
It is not the Government's role to tell the people what is true, it is the responsibility of the people themselves to understand truth.
This is the real danger to our society, the further destabilising of our social cohesion through outright fascist security measures such as this legislation.
